description.narrative: Assist youth and adults in acquiring knowledge and developing skills beyond basic literacy and numeracy which are part of the basic education element, attitudes, and behaviors to find legitimate jobs, establish viable self-employment ventures, and stay employed and productive in a changing economy. Create policies, programs, and systems that respond to labor market demands in the formal and informal sectors.

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

description.narrative: Improve early childhood education, primary education, and secondary education, delivered in formal or non-formal settings. It includes literacy, numeracy, and other basic skills programs for youth and adults.

De-legitimize the use of terror by seeking to highlight the fundamental immorality, costs, and negative impacts of using violence and to emphasize the benefits of using peaceful, tolerant alternatives.

Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Objective, when applicable and appropriate.

title.narrative: Advancing Learning and Employability for a Better Future

description.narrative: Advancing Learning and Employability for a Better Future

Improve the way the legislature and legislative processes and procedures work to uphold democratic practices. Focus on the quality and effectiveness of legislation, including the constitution, codes, laws, and regulations applying to various development sectors. Increase the legislatures capacity to be responsive to the people it serves, enhance public participation, engage in policy-making, hold itself and the executive accountable, and oversee the implementation of government programs, budgets, and laws.

Provide technical assistance and training to strengthen sub-national government functions, including development of budgets, local revenue raising, provision of local public services, community planning, participation, and implementation of laws, regulations, policies, and programs. Develop and/or strengthen associations of local governments and/or local government officials.

description.narrative: Education & Training for Emplpyment

Improve policies, laws, regulations, and administrative practices affecting the private sector. Includes reducing barriers to competition and unwarranted distortions to market prices; reducing policy and regulatory barriers to establishing, operating, and closing businesses; strengthening the legal framework surrounding property rights that is fair to both men and women, contract enforcement, and dispute resolution, along with the administration of those laws; reducing incentives for corruption and promoting transparent business practices; strengthening the legal framework surrounding intellectual property rights; and improving laws and regulations affecting the creation, dissemination, and use of technology. It also includes improving policies and regulations affecting technology choices and production behaviors with environmental impacts; and improving policies, laws, and regulations affecting hiring and firing of workers, wages, working conditions, and collective bargaining. Includes support for specific improvements as well as efforts to strengthen the institutions that contribute to designing and implementing further improvements.

description.narrative: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

title.narrative: Safe Truck and Bus Driving Academy (ACCES) activity

description.narrative: The partnership will establish a new Academy of Excellence able to provide training in safe and defensive driving, fuel-efficient driving and relevant soft skills for trucks and buses. The training academy is envisioned to be modern, demand-driven and operational within an existing Vocational Training Center (VTC). The academy is expected to train a minimum of 120 beneficiaries annually and will place a strong emphasis on promoting road safety. The project life span will be four years.

Objectives for Morocco: The project aims to help narrow the skill shortage in the road transport sector by providing courses on safe and defensive driving, fuel efficiency for various types of trucks and buses, and soft skills, such as professional communication and customer service. Engaging both the public and private sector, the Academy will offer a highly-specialized driver training program that combines both theoretical and practical training as well as career guidance in order to help students smoothly transition from the Academy into the workforce.

(Morocco): .Despite Morocco's successful pro-market reforms in recent years, many Moroccans continue to express a profound sense of exclusion rooted in the belief that these gains are not spread evenly across different groups and regions. USAID aims to address this sense of exclusion through integrated governance and economic growth programming in one of Morocco's most marginalized regions: Beni Mellal-Khenifra (BMK). ISED-BMK is working closely with regional governments, the private sector, academia, and civil society to increase civic participation in local governance, support capabilities of sub-national governments in planning and budgeting, improve the business-enabling environment, and enhance employability and employment of target populations. ISED-BMK is continuing a model of co-creation to implement this program, ensuring all activities are tailored to local needs, and that stakeholder engagement helps shape a collaborative, iterative, and highly adaptive relationship among partners. ..This implementing mechanism will meet the $250,000 attribution to women's leadership..

Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. title.narrative: Inclusive Socio-Economic Development Program - Marrakesh Safi

description.narrative: (Morocco): Morocco has made tremendous economic progress, as a country. However, several regions, communities, and demographic groups have yet to see the benefits of their country's investments. This program aims to address known drivers of exclusion through integrated democracy, governance, and economic growth programming in the Marrakech-Safi (MS) region. USAID will work closely with regional and communal governments, the private sector, academia, and civil society to increase civic participation in local governance, support capabilities of sub-national governments around planning and budgeting, facilitate improvements to the business-enabling environment and support the regional government to increase employment opportunities.

description.narrative: (Morocco): The Bridge to Middle School activity will support the Ministry of Education (MOE) to identify strategies and alternatives for supporting students' transition from upper primary to middle school. USAID will invest in the analysis and remediation of student learning difficulties in the upper primary grades, and in support of the development of innovative curricula and materials for grades 7-9 of the middle school instructional cycle. Provision of good quality curricula and improved instructional approaches will improve the knowledge and skills of the Moroccan population beyond present systems. USAID assistance will help build social and institutional capital, which will further advance Morocco on the path to self-reliance and will have a positive impact on the investment climate and sustainable inclusive growth. The Bridge to Middle School activity will: a) analyze students' difficulties in Arabic, science and math, in grades 4-6, b) assist the ministry to pilot innovative remediation strategies to address these challenges, c) support the development and piloting of new Arabic, English, and STEM curricula in grades 7-9, and d) conduct research and policy reform to facilitate the scale-up of these new curricula system-wide. This activity will generate data and information, which will further contribute to evidence-based policy development. Lessons learned from the pilot interventions will be used to support policy dialogue and the scale-up of national education reforms in upper-primary and middle schools.

Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: The USAID-funded Morocco Civil Society Advocacy Project (SANAD) advocated for citizens, especially the young and poor, and strengthened the sustainability and outreach capability of more than 700 civil society organizations, including 262 PTAs, 40 youth associations and 50 organizations on e-advocacy. SANAD means reinforcement in Moroccan Arabic and refers to the significant progress that civil society has achieved in recent years. Through partnerships with civil society networks and leveraging public funding, SANAD adapted to the changing landscape of dealing with civil society pre- and post-Arab Spring.

Objectives for Morocco: USAID aims to promote locally-driven development by: 1) Strengthening internal capacities, organizational practices, and overall skills in order to become the go-to center for other CSOs. 2) Building other NGOs core skills to more effectively influence public policy making and implementation. 3) Developing networks among other CSOs to collectively engage in the public policy process, advocacy work, and enforcing accountability on decision-makers.

Support and strengthen the negotiation process and implement peace and reconciliation processes, accords and ceasefire agreements at track levels 1, 2 and 3, including support to indigenous peacebuilding efforts. For a peace/negotiations process to have a chance of success, it must entail building trust in the process, between parties, and among their constituents, with a special focus on including women. Illustrative activities include negotiation training; platform development; public opinion polling; facilitation activities; elder statesmen engagement; provision of international expert advice and knowledge; financial support to parties; multi-stakeholder dialogues; assistance with the design of peacebuilding training programs; support and maintenance of agreed verification mechanisms; support to complaint tracking mechanisms; and work with local and national government representatives to bring them closer to their constituencies.

title.narrative: Favorable Opportunities to Reinforce Self-Advancement for Todays Youth (FORSATY)

description.narrative: (Morocco): Contributing to the CVE key issue attribution and DRG earmark, the Favorable Opportunities to Reinforce Self-Advancement for Today's Youth (FORSATY) Project seeks to prevent youth delinquency and reduce recidivism among at-risk youth. Utilizing a positive youth development approach, youth in selected marginalized neighborhoods benefit from education, life skills, and other services to ensure school success and employment placements. FORSATY also seeks to enhance youth's livelihoods and social and personal assets (physical, intellectual, psychological and emotional development), while involving their families and larger community. In order to reinforce linkages to community-based organizations and social services, the project improves the ability of youth-serving institutions to champion an assets-based approach to youth development. USAID will use $500,000 in FY 2017 funds in addition to prior year funding to extend and expand CVE programming to additional locations in Morocco.

Objectives for Morocco: The project seeks to provide positive opportunities for extremely vulnerable youth in the north of Morocco. In this highly-conservative region, traditional norms often deny women the ability to be autonomous, educated, and actively participate in public life. FORSATY is partnering with local community actors to tackle deep-rooted gender issues to encourage greater female participation in school, the workforce, and extra-curricular activities.

description.narrative: (Morocco): This activity seeks to support the development of five Moroccan Intermediary Support Organizations (ISOs). The program partners through a competitive process with existent local CSOs or networks of CSOs whose goal is to nurture the development of a strong independent civil society sector in Morocco. These ISOs provide extensive training and coaching to Moroccan CSOs in professional management and organizational capacity, networking organizations together, providing a venue for lessons learned amongst CSOs, disseminating current research findings, as well as serving as advocates for the civil society sector enabling environment. To encourage sustainability, the Association Marocaine de Solidarité et de Développement (AMSED) itself receives extensive technical assistance to develop their own strategic and business plans.

Objectives for Morocco: USAID aims to promote locally-driven development by: 1) Strengthening internal capacities, organizational practices, and overall skills in order to become the go-to center for other CSOs. 2) Building other NGOs core skills to more effectively influence public policy making and implementation. 3) Developing networks among other CSOs to collectively engage in the public policy process, advocacy work, and enforcing accountability on decision-makers.

(Morocco): In Morocco, private sector growth is constrained by a lack of skills (technical and soft) among workers, while university and vocational graduates often struggle to find employment on par with their qualifications. USAID Career Center works to help bridge the gap between the end of education and beginning of employment through two lines of effort: establishing a series of high quality career development centers at public universities and vocational institutions; and embedding work readiness training into the Moroccan tertiary and vocational education systems. USAID will open the remaining sixth physical career center, while ensuring that the model meets host-country expectations to ensure long-term sustainability. Improving youth employability is a strategic goal of Mission Morocco and a wise investment in Morocco's future economic and social stability. Of the total planned funding, $2,500,000 is attributed to the Higher Education earmark.

Objectives for Morocco: The project works to reduce womens barriers to accessing employment opportunities by designing and delivering work readiness training and career counseling services. It also contributes to changing norms and beliefs in order to encourage both men and women to work in sectors or positions that are not traditionally filled by their gender.

title.narrative: Reading for Success - National Program for Reading (NPR)

description.narrative: (Morocco): .The Reading for Success - National Program for Reading (NPR) activity is carried out in partnership with the Ministry of National Education, Vocational Training, Higher Education and Scientific Research (MOE) to build the Ministry's capacity to develop effective Arabic language curriculum and instructional materials and to improve teaching skills and techniques for monitoring student progress through professional development programs. The core of this activity is the scale-up and evaluation of an evidence-based early grade reading program in grades one and two, with greater emphasis on phonics and less emphasis on comprehension; and the development, experimentation, implementation, and evaluation of a reading program in grades three and four with greater emphasis on reading comprehension and less emphasis on phonics. Due to the success achieved during its first two years of implementation, and in response to the MOE's request, NPR was expanded in its second year of implementation to include grades 5 and 6, covering the full primary school cycle. Through NPR, USAID is improving reading materials used in primary schools, improving reading instruction in primary schools, expanding extra-curricular reading enrichment programs, and improving learning and assessment systems..

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Objective, when applicable and appropriate.

The U.S. Agency for International Development and Volvo Group have a public-private partnership to operate a training academy in Morocco that will promote economic growth, youth employment and gender equality in North and West Africa. The academy will train 150 students each year from Morocco, Cte dIvoire and Senegal, focusing on maintenance of industrial and commercial equipment. Training will also include technology and general business skills to prepare graduates to enter the modern workforce- either employed by local or multinational companies like Volvo, or as entrepreneurs running their own businesses. The partnership with Volvo Group, announced by USAID at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Morocco, includes the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), the Moroccan Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training and the Office Chrifien des Phosphates Foundation (OCPF).

Objectives for Morocco: USAID aims to contribute to narrowing the gap between supply and demand of skilled labor and boost youth employability in the heavy-duty machinery sector by: Establishing the specialized training academy in Settat, Morocco that leverages public and private sector partnership and that is fully furnished with modern equipment; Developing industry-relevant curricula based on labor market analysis and training needs assessment and covering key technical and soft skills; Delivering labor-market oriented training based on industry needs; Providing career services to assist students in accessing the job market; Fostering regional cooperation by opening up the academy to Ivoirian and Senegalese youth.

Recognizing water as a national security issue for Morocco and its neighbors in the region, USAID is using science and technology to establish modernized and more sustainable water management practices in Morocco. The H2O Maghreb activity aims to identify cutting edge solutions to urgent water needs in Morocco and the region, while also increasing the employability skills of young Moroccans by providing them with a Water Knowledge Hub and Training Center that delivers market-driven training programs. As the fruit of a partnership bringing together the public and private spheres, H2O Maghreb brings state-of-the-art equipment and an Aquatronics curriculum, delivered through technical training using virtual reality (VR) tools, to the National Office for Electricity and Water. Aquatronics combines elements of water management from different professions in both the public and private industrial sectors, thereby meeting the challenges of improving water access and water treatment in a systematic manner.

Objectives for Morocco: USAID/Morocco is supporting a program to work with leading political parties to strengthen their efforts to better respond to citizens and represent their interests. USAID/Morocco also supports work to strengthen civil societys capacity to engage the electoral and legislative process and promote civic awareness. To advance these goals, the program works in the following areas: Citizen engagement: Increase political party engagement with citizens at the local level, both through more open party structures and elected government Policy and platform development: Improve the ability of political parties to develop and implement policies that reflect citizens needs and expectations Youth and women empowerment: Strengthen the ability of women and youth to participate actively and play meaningful roles within their political party structures and as elected representatives Electoral reform, observation and pollwatching: Improve the ability of political parties and civil society to monitor and reform the electoral processCivil society engagement in the legislative process: Improve the capacity of CSOs to advance legislation that establishes their formal role in the legislative process and serves the interests of their constituent groups. Civic and voter education: Support civil society and political parties to collaboratively provide civic and voter education to promote greater political engagement of Moroccans.

description.narrative: (Morocco): Morocco's 2011 constitution brought about historic prerogatives for civil society engagement in policy-making and new roles in monitoring the implementation of democratic reforms. Most Moroccan Civil Society Organizations (CSOs), however, have limited capacity to influence public policy. Contributing toward the DRG earmark, USAID's Civil Society Strengthening Program (CSSP) facilitates dialogue and greater collaboration between CSOs and governmental and institutional actors. CSSP supports CSOs in their policy advocacy or governance oversight efforts to assist them in implementing more effective advocacy initiatives. The program also supports governmental organizations that are constitutionally charged with developing mechanisms for civil society input into governance. An example of this intervention is support for the Ministry for Relations with Parliament and Civil Society, which is playing a crucial role in the new legislation regulating non-governmental organizations.

title.narrative: Evaluation and Expansion of the Enhanced Reading Program

description.narrative: Evaluation and Expansion of the Enhanced Reading Program

(Morocco): .The Community-Oriented Policing Activity (COP) was designed to address a youth grievance identified during another CVE program (Forsaty) - that youth feel insecure in their communities and want the police to be more present and proactive. This three-year activity seeks to build mutual trust between citizens, local police and community leaders, to improve community-oriented policing and citizen-focused security. COP will continue to build the capacity of local communities, police, and local government in Tangier and Tetouan to collaboratively identify and address issues of safety, security, and livability, and enhance neighborhood security.The COP activity was initially designed in close collaboration with International Narcotics and Law Enforcement (INL). Monthly inter-agency meetings between USAID and INL are held for the purpose of updates, exchange of experiences and to strengthen the joint collaborative efforts with the Moroccan Police at the national and regional levels..

title.narrative: Reading For SuccessSmall Scale Experimentation (RFS-SSE) Activity

description.narrative: The "Reading for Success- Small-Scale Experimentation" (RFS-SSE) early-grade reading program is designed to develop and test the most effective approaches for strengthening childrens Arabic reading skills in targeted primary schools. RFS-SSE focuses on the following activities: A new approach to Arabic reading lessons based on phonics that are being developed and tested amongst a control group of first and second grade students; Developing training guides to reinforce the new approach and reading lessons for teachers, trainers, and coaches; and Reducing summer learning loss by supporting Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) to develop summer reading enrichment activities..

Objectives for Morocco: In September 2015, USAID, in close partnership with the Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training, launched the Reading for Success- Small-Scale Experimentation (RFS-SSE) early-grade reading program. This activity is designed to develop and test the most effective approaches for strengthening childrens Arabic reading skills in targeted primary schools. RFS-SSE focuses on the following activities: A new approach to Arabic reading lessons based on phonics that are being developed and tested amongst a control group of first and second grade students. Developing training guides to reinforce the new approach and reading lessons for teachers, trainers, and coaches. Reducing summer learning loss by supporting Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) to develop summer reading enrichment activities.

title.narrative: Improving Training for Quality Advancement in National Education

description.narrative: Creatives Improving Training for Quality Advancement in National Education project supports Moroccos Education Ministry in improving teachers pedagogical practice, preventing middle school dropouts and developing innovative and practical teacher training materials for nationwide use. It is funded by the U.S. Agency for International Development. In its nearly five years, the project delivered in-service professional development to more than 3,000 teachers. Meanwhile, more than 4,400 newly recruited teacher trainers received pre-service coursework.

The Morocco Economic Competitiveness Project is an integrated economic development project with the objective of reducing barriers to trade and investment in the regions of Oriental and Doukkala-Abda. The project works in the fields of business enabling environment, agriculture water management, and workforce development. Discrete activities are designed to streamline business regulations, to optimize scarce water resources, and to increase worker productivity.

The Local Governance Program (LGP2) aims to promote more effective and accountable local governance in Morocco by increasing citizen participation in local governance, enhancing local governments' performance, and encouraging increased accountability and transparency. Building on achievements from the first Local Governance Program that RTI implemented from 2005 to 2009, LGP2 emphasizes providing youth and women with opportunities to participate in local affairs and strengthening the capacity of governments to mobilize revenue and develop innovative partnerships in delivering key local services. RTI will implement an innovative communications plan incorporating a variety of methodspeer-to-peer workshops, dissemination of governance messages, and posting project results on Web sitesto reach the media, other communes, and citizens.

title.narrative: Middle East North Africa Investment Initiative (MENAII)

description.narrative: The Middle East North Africa Investment Initiative (MENAII) will provide needed support to early stage businesses in order to create and sustain jobs, advance and develop the investment eco-system and encourage increased equity investment in early stage businesses.In order to achieve this, USAID grantee will partner with qualified members of the early stage private sector investment community, ranging from Incubators/Accelerators to Angels to Venture Capital in the Middle East region by providing: 1) Matching Investment Capital; 2) 100% Cash Collateralized Insurances, and; 3) Technical Assistance.
Support the start-up and expansion of self-employment and micro and small enterprises owned and operated by low-income people.

title.narrative: Pre-award assessment of the Rehabilitation and Reintegration Program

description.narrative: Pre-award assessment of the Rehabilitation and Reintegration Program

Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations.
